intro: Roettlera rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed roettlera, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its reddish stems and small white or pale yellow flowers make it distinctive, though it is not widely cultivated for ornamental purposes.
